website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight finish nailer that includes a 34° magazine for reaching inside tough angled areas.
pros: Easy to clear any nail jams from the tool's nose
Includes an air duster that clears debris from the area where the nail will strike
Can adjust the air exhaust direction to keep the air out of the operator's face
Easy to adjust the depth of the nails
Offers multiple settings for driving nails with the trigger or by depressing the nose
cons: Nail depth accuracy isn't as consistent as it should be

customer_reviews.title: Great finish gun
customer_reviews.text: We are a general contractor that do high end homes and we own about 8 of these and that should say all you need. We have tried all of the finish guns out there and this it the lightest one that we have had the least amount of problems with. If this is your first one you wont be dissapointed for any of your finish needs
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement!
customer_reviews.text: You do not get what’s in the picture. I would have bought from a different seller if I knew about the false advertisement. You will get a metabo and appears to be cheaper quality that other Hitachi products I’ve purchased. I didn’t have time to return the product because I needed a nail gun the day it arrived so now I’m stuck with a product I didn’t order or want.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: Hanging doors and fitting MDF baseboard... what a machine... love it... straight out of the box, set compressor to 85 lbs loaded the 2-1/2" 14308 15 gauge nails and half the house 3500 sq ft is more the 60% done in two days single handed.. Without a doubt this is my new favorite tool...it paid for itself in 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: S McD

customer_reviews.title: Needs a raptor hook!
customer_reviews.text: It needs a raptor hook! Such a pain working on ladders and windows. Damn thing almost fell off the ladder and injured someone.. at least give us a option! Not having this is terrible! Ive used this on one job only and it already it looks like ive been using it for years due to scratches. I wouldn't have that problem if I could just hang it. Other than that it works, no hook is a real down side..
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nailer
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm right out of the box. Lightweight, fast, and powerful. The 15 gauge nails are heavy enough for almost any finish project. Although you can adjust the power setting on the nailer, I prefer adjusting the power level on the compressor. I ended up hanging siding with this nailer in order to hide the nail patterns and the 2 inch nails were exceptionally strong. Some folks don't like the angled nailers, but I am highly pleased how it can get into tight spaces. It's hard to beat Hitachi nailers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: Metabo 15G nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi product, confused me at first: With about an hour of study, I realized who bought who etc. Not a single contractor have a seen yet, with this product- asked everyone I knew. At first people were telling me- "Go with a name brand you know." After a- little research: It's Hitachi!! ( A great tool making company). Did stair treads and exterior Lattice work- Great Product!! ( I am not a fan of HD brands)
customer_reviews.author: Atomix Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool, low maintenance, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Hitachi tools--I have a HT drill, circular saw, sander, and now this guy. The price seems to be right in the middle of most of their competitor's prices, but the quality is near the top. My HT drill is nearly ten years old and it still works beautifully. This nailer doesn't jam, is easy to use, and is low-maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable nailer
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install door casings, baseboard, crown molding, and beadboard in our son and daughter-in-laws house. I've run about 1000 nails through it so far with zero misfires or other problems. I like the depth adjustment and the rubber foot which protects the trim from marring. I also like the fact that there is enough room in the case for a small oil bottle and some extra nail sticks. The only negative is that it will dry fire, leaving a hole but no nail in the trim. I've gotten better at being aware of running out of nails but still occasionally forget to reload before it is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Pounding nails with a hammer would be horrible
customer_reviews.text: I'm more than 3,000 nails into a tongue and groove ceiling job, and I cannot imagine using a hammer to do this work. This Metabo HPT Finish Nailer is easy enough to use, light enough to use all day, and has been 100% reliable. I'm running it at 90 pounds and it sets the nails a shade under the surface of the 23/32" pine tongue and groove car siding I am using. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: This is not A Hitachi as pictured, it is called Metabo
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to inform future purchasers that if you order this thinking you are getting a Hitachi, what you will received is called a Metabo, I included pictures so you can see it. I've only used it a couple of times, and it is ok, light weight, nice to handle, but its still new. I was just a little miffed that I was not informed of what I would be receiving. As per the box, the company is now metabo, maybe others are aware of this, I was not , never heard of this company before.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri A

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Used this finish nailer for a couple trim projects and have been very pleased. Easily adjustable depth. No-Mar bumper. Lighter than I expected. Nail angle is specific to Hitachi.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the device I owned before
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a nailer that needed a "driver kit". The internet said that the driver kit replacement many times leads to other issues as well. The driver kit was almost as expensive as this nail gun and this gun was rated much higher by its users. This gun worked flawlessly while remodeling a bathroom and doing some work on a kitchen. Plus, it accepts the nails I already have laying around. Highly recommend this unit. Buy the Hitachi Oil.
customer_reviews.author: waitingForTheStorm

customer_reviews.title: Never a misfire with extensive use.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hitachi nailer, the first was stolen never to be seen again. Have used on an large hard wood floor and molding restoration in my 120 year old home. never a misfire, not to heavy and the air duster should be standard on all nail guns. the next project was to build a new kitchen, 30 feet of cabinets made, again with no problems. I continue to use on other projects and because of its quality I would recommend to all!
customer_reviews.author: mcdtc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Metabo 15 gauge finish nailer for a tongue and groove ceiling and the nailer worked flawlessly! It comes in a nice hard case with a user manual and a pair of safety glasses. I used 2-1/2" Metabo finishing nails and did not have a single issue, no James or misfires. The depth is easy to adjust and and sets the nail perfect every time. There is a button on the back that puts out a spray of air for cleaning dust. Only thing that it needs is a belt hook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Nail gun fired but did not drive the nail, nails bent and jammed in gun. Returned, purchased different brand. This is not a reflection on the seller, but the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I didn’t buy one of these things years ago. Super easy to use. Five minutes out of the box I was installing headboard and chair rails like I knew what I was doing. Worth the price on the first use. Highly recommend. There are a lot of good videos on YouTube showing how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price and value!
customer_reviews.text: Rebranded Hitachi, still great as always. I originally thought the addition of a button to operate an “air blower” feature might be just a gimmick, but it’s actually a great addition that I frequently. I would buy again. So much better price than store!
customer_reviews.author: JMB

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: Used this gun for about a week and it stopped firing. The head would not seem to reset. Had to disconnect it from the air hose and then it would work for one nail. Had to finally buy another brand. And since it was past the 30 days, could not return it. Not going to order anymore tools from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable - Needs Metal Nail Magazine
customer_reviews.text: While this appears to function reliably, I expect all metal construction on a tool of this caliper and price. The only nail gun I could find that still uses an aluminum magazine is Makita. I did keep this unit. ~JSmith
customer_reviews.author: JSmith

customer_reviews.title: So far, excellent.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it has been flawless. The first couple of shots were... "tight" (I'm not sure how else to put it), but the 2-1/2" stainless nails drove into the exterior plastic trim and wood nevertheless. Since then, I haven't had to clear a jam, or anything. If it starts to suck, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Scotch

customer_reviews.title: hitachi is the brand of choice for many pros.  this product didnt live up to the name.
customer_reviews.text: The nail magazine is plastic which screams cheap. The nail feed spring design seems amatuerish. i would have to fiddle before the tensioning spring would properly seat the nail strips. after a couple days, the trigger would leak when depressed, & pause before it would fire.
customer_reviews.author: fleeflam

customer_reviews.title: Love it. There's no cons that I can come ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. There's no cons that I can come up with thus far with the nailer, but Ive only shot a couple hundred nails. It only requires 60psi to shoot a 1.25" nails flush into normal soft lumber. I will say that I've learned to shoot them in at an angle so that they hold better.
customer_reviews.author: Jumpin Jehosaphat

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - PRODUCT IS NOT AS DESCRIBED IN LISTING
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Hitachi gun for over a year at work and wanted to get my own. Displeased that I was sent a Metabo instead of what was listed. The model number is the same as the old Hitachi up to the little (s) at the end of the Metabo part number? The complete lack of mentioning this is in the listing is huge oversight that could be misleading at best, or malicious at worts. Also you can buy this gun way cheaper from other sellers, so check around. On the plus side their customer service seems to be fast, will be updating this as more information comes in.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice nailer. I'm using it with the DeWalt pancake ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice nailer. I'm using it with the DeWalt pancake compressor and Flexzilla hose. I sank 2-1/2" Senco nails into a door jam and trim using about 80 psi. Easy to handle and comfortable to hold. The rubber tip is nice and it's easy to see where the nail will shoot from. Haven't had any jams yet. No air leaks either. You should use a 1/4" female quick connect for ease of connecting and disconnecting the nailer to the hose. The duster is a nice feature. Carrying case is pretty solid but not contractor grade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: the Hitachi brand lives up to a great standard. I'm very pleased with the nailer
customer_reviews.text: As always, the Hitachi brand lives up to a great standard. I'm very pleased with the nailer, it's lighter weight than I expected which is a plus from my perspective. The only negative I have, has nothing to do with the nailer so I didn't dock its points. But someone opened the box and removed the nose cap. Nothing else was missing, just that small piece, and I will have to trordering it but usually companies don't restock that item, probably why it was stollen.. But still, it's a great tool, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2Hike66

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Finish Nailer At A Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice finish nailer for a reasonable price. Used this for a flooring project. Worked perfectly. Not a single jam, or failure to feed. Its light, but its powerful. It is a bit loud, but nailers generally are not quiet. Well worth the investment if you need a finish nailer.
customer_reviews.author: John Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is a nice nail gun. Doesn’t jam, has a blow off feature, and is comfortable in the hand. Pretty light weight too. I would recommend this gun to a friend. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JAH Cloud

customer_reviews.title: great advancement
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model while installing crown molding, It was lent to me. Planning on finishing the cellar and will use the new one there. I'm an old man and the eyes aren't what they once were , this saves the shoulder and eliminates the setting of finish nails. Wish I had it 45 years ago
customer_reviews.author: phil tierney

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very inconsistent performance. Be prepared for this nailer to put holes in your woodwork without it driving a nail. I recommend you pass on this nailer
customer_reviews.author: George P

customer_reviews.title: Not working properly. Keeps jamming up.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps jamming up and I dont have time to return this thing. Its defective.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D2

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile nailer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, versatile nailer. Although the title says "finish nailer" I have been using it extensively on a 3/4" hardwood flooring installation and it's accomplished everything I've thrown at it from flooring to baseboards and quarter round. No jambs, no issues at all. I've used nails from around 1" to 2 1/2", varied pressure to get the right set. The angle design lets me nail flooring at a 45 throiugh the tongue very nicely. The narrow head lets me get into fairly tight places. A few drops of oil every couple hundred nails is all it asks and it keeps on delivering.
customer_reviews.author: RickyB

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool you can buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nail guns before and they used to jam all the time. I love this Hitachi nailer!!!! I was determined to just do the old fashioned way with a hammer and nail set. This nailer was the best investment I have made!!! It allowed me to get all my baseboards installed I no time, and the results look great!!! I wish I bought this a long time ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi NT65MA4 - Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install crown molding. My mistake was in buying it after I had already installed the molding in most of the rooms in my house. I should have bought it before I started so I could have used it during the whole project. This nailer is fantastic. It's the second Hitachi pneumatic nailer I have purchased. The first was a brad nailer that is also easy to use and no trouble at all. Both are superior pneumatic tools. I made the mistake of buying another brand first and have learned my lesson. If you need a pneumatic nailer buy a Hitachi. I will never buy any other brand again.
customer_reviews.author: SJMiller

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Awesome nail gun. I was apprehensive about buying something "used" but the notes about it were 100% accurate, it was really a new gun with a minor blemish on the front of it. I put it to use with Senco nails and put up tongue and groove cedar siding in my shop...about 1200 lineal feet with no misfires. Just perfect every time. This is my third Hitachi nail gun, I also have their framing and roofing models. Could not be happier with all three of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyp

customer_reviews.title: Metabo Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Nice , light gun, definitely likes at least 75psi plus ! Sets nails perfectly when dialed in.
customer_reviews.author: triad33

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Nice gun and, as usual, Hitachi doesn't disappoint. Good value. Not overly heavy. I like the built in air blower for clearing my work space, etc. Easy to clear jambs although based on the fact that I've only shot a 1/2 box of nails, I don't think I've had any yet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Self destructed on the second nail i shot
customer_reviews.text: Self destructed on the second nail i shot. im returning this now what a pos
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Good gun
customer_reviews.text: Never jammed after 1000’s of nails fired. Reliable, consistent, depth control actually works
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: I own some other brands and this one just keeps on going. It is slightly louder than the PC I own and is smaller too. I do like the air blower on the front of the gun. It allows me to blow out dust and sawdust before installing something that needs to be installed flush to a surface. Because the blower part is there I will use it rather than skip that part or remove the gun and attach a blow gun and then re-attach the gun if it were not there. It saves some steps and time for blowing sawdust and junk.
customer_reviews.author: gb93433

customer_reviews.title: I think this is my favorite tool.
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought this thing I've been a champion around the house. Need a fence? Bam! Texas sized Chicken coupe? Under a day! Floor boards look nasty? Instant face lift. I've treated this tool like crap. It takes a beating and works right every time. Every now and then I wipe the rail and spray it with some white lithium grease made by wd-40. Has a cool air sprayer button too, great for dust, cats, and hair drying.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Clemenson

customer_reviews.title: Great Nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and found this nail gun was what I wanted. They had it at the local big box store, but the price was $20 more. I have Prime, so the next day I had this for my project and it saved me tons of time. Great Nail gun.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: It is light and easy to load
customer_reviews.text: It is light and easy to load, but it shoots a lot blanks. Takes two and sometimes three trigger pulls to get a nail in the wood. This leaves a dent where ever the blank occurs.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Good nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Works great, a little loud for the size of the gun, tends to leave a little paper retained in the nail hole at times (using hitachi nails) bit easily removed just wiping my finger over the nail hole.
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: The best 15ga finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent nailer at any price. Lightweight and powerful. Just for kicks I decided to try it in dry trim grade red oak. At 105 psi it will fully sink a 2 1/2 nail below the surface. I use the 'blowgun' feature much more often than I thought I would when purchased. Glad its there. I've found Grip Rite nails to be excellent quality, reasonably priced, and well package in modest quantities. Senco works well too. The tool desperately needs a belt hanging device of some kind or another. Don't forget to use Pneumatic tool oil at the start of the days work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: Used the nailer to install crown molding in my dinning room. It worked like a charm. This is the fourth air tool I have in my stable. Started with a Grizzly Framing nailer, then a Porter-Cable brad and then a T-50 stapler. This tool rounds out my arsenal. With 4-5 drops of oil during use, I have not had a jam or miss fire. It has made my jobs so much easier. With the Hitachi, I use Porter-Cable 2 inch nails. No splitting and smooth operation.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Askins

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I'll buy more metabo
customer_reviews.text: no issues with this nailer at all never jammed or had any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Is this new? Or not? Missing item
customer_reviews.text: This boxed “New” item is missing the nose cap shown on the box and listed in the standard accessories and not listed under “sold separately”. How is this a new item from factory if things are missing?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardie Board Install
customer_reviews.text: Picked this due to good reviews. 500+ nails into hardie board for trim and touch ups. Followed instructions on manual, up in a minute. Works like a champ. Only 1 jam so far, no problems (easy to fix). Nice and light. Well worth it for this project (Trim installation of Siding) Depth adjustment was quick. I don't use it full time, so I don't know how that would be, but plenty of use for my projects.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: very well designed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a DeWalt airless nailer and it arrived defective. That was just as well because the airless nailer was terribly heavy and bulky. The Hitachi is well designed and very light and easy to use. The airless nailers are all too heavy for me. I didn't have to have the convenience of an airless nailer and could"t deal with their weight. I paired the nailer with a Coilhose PFE40245T hose and am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ThommoorFit

customer_reviews.title: Love it, the old goat.
customer_reviews.text: This is a work of art. Too bad I bought one just before the 18v cordless LiOn revolution happened. I can't imagine trying to hassle with a compressor and hoses and all the proper water filters and oilers necessary to keep this tool humming, but still I'm happy I own it.
customer_reviews.author: nibbles

customer_reviews.title: Tough as Nails
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, tough and durable ( I've dropped it from a ladder three times w/o a problem). Occasionally it misfires w/o a nail but other than that had no issues. Bought a simple Husky hanger at my local Box Store to clip it onto my belt. Love the 15 gauge hot-dipped galvanize nails for exterior work and pressure treated wood.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice nailer.
customer_reviews.text: I like it's size and weight. It's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Martin

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a Paslode or Max guy, but hitachi really came through with this gun. I am usually very careful with my tools, but this thing fell off of a 12' ladder more than once and it still keeps nailing each time I pull the trigger. It also fits in tight places really well. The only thing I don't like about it is the plastic nail slide. It has not caused me any problems yet though, and I guess it helps keep weight down.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFromWisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowner finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: An excellent finish nailer for the homeowner. I purchased it because 16 ga nails just were not heavy enough to hold some jobs. I have always had excellent reliability with hitachi products including their nail guns. I would buy it again. The only addition I would like to see is a belt hook. Sometimes troublesome to hold the gun, orient your work piece and maintain your balance on a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: RRR

customer_reviews.title: As with all my Hitachi guns it works as its ...
customer_reviews.text: As with all my Hitachi guns it works as its supposed to when its supposed to.. No complaints. Will keep buying till they fail me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rath

customer_reviews.title: First nailer
customer_reviews.text: I needed a nailer for a 1x6 tongue and groove prodject.I read all the reviews on several sites and purchased the Hitachi NT65MA4 nailer. I found that every positive review was totally accurate. The only negative comment I read was that the nailer continues to shoot even if the magazine is empty.That is not a problem if you are paying attention to what you are doing. My prodject is complete and the nailer performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: excellent finish nailer!  must make Hitachi proud.
customer_reviews.text: quickly became my favorite pneumatic tool. it’s that good. with different nail lengths you can finish all trim in a house with this.
customer_reviews.author: M.C

customer_reviews.title: its a great gun, built well and is comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the safety guard on the front ends up leaving 2 small dents in the work piece unless you position it just right. Also, the nails that Hitachi sells for it really tear through the wood and leave a huge scar. Other than that, its a great gun, built well and is comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hobbies and projects
customer_reviews.text: We make bird boxes for the Audubon in southwest Arizona. Makes assembly quick and easy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: got my first chance to use it the other day ...
customer_reviews.text: got my first chance to use it the other day. first i tried bostitich nails with it but soon realized they were at the wrong angle. porter cable works with it, but they spark every once in a while. someone told me that's just the break in period but i've never had that happen before. other than that, it shot well. plenty of power
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Super quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Super quality tool. I don,t have any previous experience with other nailers but I have been in the trades all my life. I know a well made tool when I use one. Extremely light weight yet has that hand held feel of quality. Operates flawlessly. Has never jammed unless it was from a bad nail or hitting some other foreign object in the work. One suggestion is that it needs a belt clip so you can be working from a ladder using both hands to position the work then just reach down to your belt to grab the gun.
customer_reviews.author: CRAZY8

customer_reviews.title: Great Product !
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price ! Really nice tool !
customer_reviews.author: James Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for such a fine tool
customer_reviews.text: A fine a nail gun that I have ever used, 50 years service and stil taking care of my customers need, fine tool, thank you.l
customer_reviews.author: larry r. crane

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to build a storage cabinet. Worked really well. Probably saved me from a couple bruised thumbs! Wish I had bought one of these a long time ago. I have only used it for this one project but so far it has been flawless. Appears be good duality materials and workmanship. I believe that it will hold up with reasonable care.
customer_reviews.author: ATCZERO

customer_reviews.title: This nailer is better than even my beloved DeWalt tools
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations for quality and durability. This nailer is better than even my beloved DeWalt tools, which have always been my benchmark for quality. I took a chance on this brand, but couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi, What else do I really need to say? Had a framing nailer by Hitachi for years. Needed one for finishing nailers as my other one finally died. Light weight and easy to use actually had to drop the air pressure down to 60 PSI so I did not keep going to far into the floor molding.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Making carpentry more fun one tool at a time!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no carpenter - just a weekend handyman, but this made a number of closet re-builds a whole lot easier and more fun! Looks like it'll last a lifetime and then some if taken care of. It's got me wondering what other kinds of projects I can put it to use on....
customer_reviews.author: David J. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 15 gauge finish nailer, worked great on installing 1 inch MDF baseboard. Would definitely recommend Hitachi tools.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice gun
customer_reviews.text: Slapped some nails in her and she been working great. No problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great finishing gun
customer_reviews.text: Great finishing gun. However, I was bit disappoint in air burst clean up feature. It appeared as if you could blow air on the nailing spot without turning the gun upside down. Not a big deal, but it seems to be useless in the way it is designed,
customer_reviews.author: R. Andari

customer_reviews.title: A perfect nailer at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this nailer. I have used Porter Cable nailers for years now but decided to break the pattern and check out the Hitachi simply because I had so much luck with their 12" radial arm saw. This gun work flawlessly and securely. No jams experienced so far. It exhibit good quality in the details and I expect it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anderse

customer_reviews.title: Works great...
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ..... Used it on a bay window project, worked flawlessly. Used 1.5 and 2 inch nails. Picked those up at Lowe's.
customer_reviews.author: xjfan

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: This Hitachi is light weight and strong. It has many nice features and performs flawlessly. I have many projects that will go easier with this and end up better. It is quite easy on the ears and uses Senco nails. I haven't ever owned a nailer before, but have used a friends and this compares well to more expensive guns. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: SLF

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun but crappy nail magazine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reliable 15G nailer. It seems trivial, but I really like the air blower feature. The only concern I have is that the nail magazine is flimsy plastic (presumably to save weight). I'm a finish carpenter and with daily use I'd rather have a metal magazine or at least a stronger plastic. I hope the replacement part is cheap...
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Blow off feature actually useful for getting regulator pressure at your number
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Blow off feature actually useful for getting regulator pressure at your number.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Superior nailer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of the rest, it's outlasted all other 15 gauge nailers I've had. I got one 8 years ago, this is my 2nd very happy with it...
customer_reviews.author: Amaz-in-Grace

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic finish nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Wholly cow batman !! This is a fantastic finish nail gun. It gets in corners and is VERY powerful. Remember, you will need to get a smaller gun for the small size 1.25" and down. Always put a drop or 2 of oil in the gun before using. Buy with confidence !! Gadget
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control & Deceit
customer_reviews.text: A PATTERN OF DECEIT. I HAVE NOW RECEIVED SEVERAL ITEMS FROM ORDERS, NOW, INCLUDING THIS ONE, WHICH ARE THE WRONG MODEL. NEED TO STOP WASTING MY TIME NOW DOING THEIR JOB!!
customer_reviews.author: Reality Check Please

customer_reviews.title: It's reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Over 300 nails without a jam. I returned the Makita for this because the Makita would jam every 20 nails.
customer_reviews.author: HUGH T

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my son in the building business and he uses it all the time and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality nail gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun to remodel several rooms in my house. It worked beautifully out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: BDJ322

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer!
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi makes some great nailguns. This is the companion to my Hitachi brad nailer and between the two of them, I can get most jobs done, from flooring to trim work. This gun has no problem driving a 2 1/2" nail through 3/4" Brazilian Cherry all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Best out there
customer_reviews.text: Best 15ga nailer. It’s a workhorse and I Love the case!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I love this gun. really easy to use, oil, and shoot dust free.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it much, but so far so good. I'm not a big fan of their design of the safety tip that prevents the gun from marring the work surface. It functions just fine, it just seems unnecessarily big. Otherwise, everything seems well designed and well built.
customer_reviews.author: TucsonTRD

customer_reviews.title: Already needs service
customer_reviews.text: I can count the times I used his gun on one hand. 20 hours of work minimum and its misfiring and needs service to be repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and love it, my ridgid lasted 10+ years using it almost daily. This felt better the first nail shot
customer_reviews.author: Carl Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Meets my needs. I got this as a gift for Christmas last year from my wife. I couldn't be happier with it. 15 gauge seems to fit the bill for the projects I do around the house from baseboards to crown-molding to basic trim.
customer_reviews.author: A. Legros

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! Easy to load and adjust nail depth. Perfect angle to get into tight places. Dust blower nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: vmax1

customer_reviews.title: better than more expensive nailers !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent nailer. Drives 2.5 inch 15ga nails or 1.5 nails perfectly. Using a 6gal. Small compressor at 85 lbs. Cycles fast for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: J MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi NT65MA4 15-Gauge Angle Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: While I bought a cheapo framing nailer from HF I wanted a quality nailer for when I was doing finish work. I shopped around and read a lot of reviews for finish nailers and I finally settled on this one. it's been about a year and I've used it on about a dozen projects. I've run this off of a small portable compressor and my big compressor, I've used cheap nails and expensive nails. No matter what I do this things fires perfectly every time. Dial in the pressure with some test shots and off you go. This is one of the best tools I can recall purchasing, and I got a good deal here at Amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: SixtyFourTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: love it, keep in mind that the nails it ...
customer_reviews.text: love it, keep in mind that the nails it uses ARE NOT to build a house. but it is for smaller jobs around the house. it worked great for me and the medium to light work around the house.
customer_reviews.author: M SaL

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My husbands old one broke. This one seems to be doing the job well. He is a contractor and we are renovating our house. Well used.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia McClanahan

customer_reviews.title: very balanced gun.
customer_reviews.text: I used this gun to nail trim boards. After I practiced on scrap boards to adjust the depth of the nails, I finished the job in no time! It's not too heavy and it is very balanced - I can turn it and twist it easily. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Love hitachi always have got a new brad nailer too
customer_reviews.author: thomas w nelsen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price I will never use a hammer again; I recomend this tool to others.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. This is the first nail gun I've ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. This is the first nail gun I've ever used and I'm impressed. Easy to use. Feels really solid. Haven't had a single jam yet. I'll never swing a hammer again..
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. I use the Hitachi brand nails in it and a 5-gallon air compressor and it buzzes through strips of nails like a dream. I rarely use the dusting feature, but when I do, I'm glad for it. I used this to put up a 100+feet of 6 foot cedar fence with no problems. Everything is easy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Another well thought out Hitatchi tool
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I have found to dislike on this nail gun. It does everything I expect a finish nailer to do. It adjusts well and predictably. It is easy to load and unload. The angle is perfect for many types of nails. Time will tell how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Veniceneon

customer_reviews.title: Problem with my return
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item, I would like to return, for some reason, UPS store would not take my paper I had from amazon, unfortunately I did not have a good experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tri- State

product_meta.title: Hitachi NT65MA4 1-1/4 Inch to 2-1/2 Inch 15-Gauge Angled Finish Nailer with Air Duster
product_meta.description:
The NT65MA4 15-Gauge angled finish nailer is the ideal nailer for installing crown and base moldings, window and door casings, chair rails, cabinets, exterior trim and staircases. Its compact body and angled magazine make for easier placement and operation in tight angles. The integrated air duster clears debris from the work site allowing for faster and cleaner job completion. The NT65MA4 accepts 15-gauge nails from 1-1/4" up to 2-1/2" in length. Includes: Safety Glasses (875769), No Mar Tip (881751), 1/4" NPT Male Plug (190001), Carrying Case (884340). Weight - 4.2 lbs, Length - 13-9/16", Height - 12", Width - 3-1/4", Operating Pressure - 70-120 PSI, Grip - Rubber, Nail Capacity - 100 nails, Magazine Type - Rear Loading, Nail Diameter - 15-Gauge, Nail Lengths - 1-1/4" - 2-1/2", Magazine Angle - 34 Degrees

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi NT65MA4 2-1/2-Inch Angle Finish Nailer features Hitachi's new industrial design and fires 15-gauge nails from 1-1/4-inch to 2-1/2-inch. The integrated air duster makes clearing debris from work surfaces quick and easy. Simply press the button and clear the surface where you need to place the nail. This finish nailer has an easy clear nose, a depth of drive dial and sequential or contact nailing modes. With its lightweight aluminum housing, the NT65MA4 may be used for the installation of crown and base moldings, window and door casings, chair rails, cabinets, exterior trim and staircases. This package comes with safety glasses, a no-mar tip and a handy carrying case. Its tool-free depth adjustment provides simplicity and flexibility when fastening various types of wood. The easy clear nose makes for quick extraction in instances of nail jams. The Hitachi NT65MA4 2-1/2-Inch Angle Finish Nailer is warranted to the original purchaser to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for a period of 5-years from the original purchase date. In addition any pistons, drivers and O-rings associated with this tool are covered by a 90-day warranty. from the original purchase date. Hitachi Power Tools provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry.
feature_bullets: Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT. Same great tools, with only a new name.
Integrated air duster can be used to clear away dust and debris from the work surface in preparation for nailing or gluing
Tool less, easy to clear nose for quick nail extraction should a nail jam during use
Tool less depth of drive dial adjusts for flush fastening into varying materials for improved control and a professional finish
360 degree fully adjustable exhaust portal directs air exhaust away from the user or work piece
At only 4.2 pounds, this finish nailer minimizes user fatigue, while increasing maneuverability
34 degree magazine angle allows the user to reach into corners or tight spaces with ease
No mar tip protects the work surface from damage and can be removed if not needed
Rubber grip adds comfort and a secure hold
Selective actuation switch allows for either sequential or contact nailing with a simple flip of the switch no tools or parts required
